You realise that now our entire economic policy is entirely dependent on EU politics that we now have no input or influence over?
Great day :-)
The stupidity is giving me a ball ache.
Who cares

Our entire economy David? We trade with the world not just 440m people in the EU.
We trade with Japan, we aren't in a political union with them.
Put down your cappuccino and except there is a lot more to the world than Europe.

Lol that's only till the EU crumbles especially when France vote for their new president in 4 weeks and it looks like the NF will win by a landslide..Then they will trigger a referendum to leave the EU which the French will want, as that's what the NF party want... the EU is a dying star about to burn out...  so there will be no EU politics to influence any policy's the UK make........

Unless the EU sorts out mass unemployment,  southern debt etc the right will get stronger. Italy is a basket case but they will hold on to their euro dream.

Dave Hambleton The largest trade partner ALWAYS defines the deal and we have NO other trade deals with anyone around the world once we leave the EU. Whats to say we do a deal with the US and the EU says to them "our trade with you is worth 10 times your trade with the UK so make sure their deal is much worse then ours"... nothing... There is a reason nations are forming large trade blocks ... well the clever ones anyway
Don't you just love today.
Just speculation not facts, funny how all of a sudden we have people that can see into the future... 😂😂😂😂

Europe would not want 3m extra unemployed citizens if they wrecked our economy and saw Europeans go home.

Andrea, a lot us speak sense, like a lot of leave voters. But some of us can't tolerate the uneducated and immature. Like ones who say "why don't you move to another country that's in the EU" as it clearly shows their knowledge of what leaving does. (It removes our right to freely move out of the country). Doesn't mean you can't move, but it's not simple like it used to be, you now have to apply for things and what not, the process now takes at least 3 times longer if not more as we cannot freely move to another country. 

I've heard leave voters saying out loud in public to a Muslim woman to "get out of the country, we voted out" despite the fact she's British born and bred and so are her parents and so forth. 
Not bashing everyone who voted leave for it, I know many in real life who voted for it, some are my best of friends! 
I've had remain voters simply call someone a Brexit voter because "she looks the kind of woman to do so". 

You can't disagree that since the referendum, there has been an increase in racially aggravated 'attacks' as some very small minded people now think they're free to say and do as they want.

I side with the remainers, and I'm rather upset about the end result, but I accept things and move on.

Capitalism and the Dutch East India Company | Crash Course World History
Join host John Green to learn about the Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie, doing business as the VOC, also known as the Dutch East India Company. In the 16th and 17th centuries, the Dutch managed to dominate world trade, and they did so through the pioneering use of corporations and finance. However, not all of their ways were new; traditional methods such as violently enforced monopolies, unfair trade agreements, and warfare also played a role in their growth. You'll learn how the Dutch came up with inventions including joint stock corporations, maritime insurance, and futures trading... and how all this affected the US economy in 2008.

Find more videos from Crash Course at our collection page here.
